column4: how come removing quiet and splash from /etc/default/grub still gives me the ugly gray boot splash on kubuntu 12.04
do you mean a plain screen?
no it has a logo and everything
can you expandon 'ugly' then please
did you run:  sudo update-grub    after editting the file, as well?
oops lol
better?
no how do I do logout or does that cover it?
do you mean from the desktop session?
can run:  sudo shutdown -r now      and it will reboot, if that's what you mean?
I mean to see verbose, not a splash
try pressing ESC during boot, plymouth should hide and you can watch the boot, the same text is present in:    dmesg | less     if the system boots fully
flash probably
no, I mean for quicktime and all that
ah, there are a few, none are 'best'
mozilla-plugin-vlc  is an option
doesnt seem to get everything. Very surprised as vlc stand alone plays everything
it can play as much as the other players you can install
you mean *plugins I install
yes, all the players will access the central store for plugins, so VLC will play as many media types as any, as they all use the same codecs
on the stand alone side of things, is there a benefit to having mplayer2 installed instead of plain mplayer. I use smplayer once in awhile and in didnt seem to install mplayer2.
not used mplayer too, I use gnome-mplayer though
